official-title.#text:
To provide for funding for construction and major
		  rehabilitation for projects located on inland and intracoastal waterways of the
		  United States, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:

			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Waterways Are Vital for the Economy,
			 Energy, Efficiency, and Environment Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds the following:

text.#text:
The inland
			 waterways navigation system is vital to the economic well-being of the
			 Nation.

Energy reliability
			 and conservation are the cornerstones of the inland waterways navigation
			 system.

The efficiency of
			 the inland waterways navigation system creates the optimum transportation mode
			 for bulk commodities in the United States.

The inland
			 waterways navigation system provides for environmental protection and ecosystem
			 sustainability.

In order to ensure continued safe,
			 dependable, highly cost-effective, and environmentally sustainable navigation
			 on the inland and intracoastal waterways of the United States, the purposes of
			 this Act are to—

optimize inland
			 waterways navigation system reliability;

minimize the size
			 and scope of inland waterways navigation project completion schedules;

make inland
			 waterways navigation capital investments through use of prioritization criteria
			 that seek to maximize system-wide benefits and minimize overall system
			 risk.
In this Act:

term.#tail:
means any construction or major rehabilitation
			 project for navigation infrastructure of the inland and intracoastal waterways
			 that is—

text.#text: The term

authorized before,
			 on, or after the date of enactment of this Act;

not completed as
			 of the date of enactment of this Act; and

funded at least in
			 part from the Inland Waterways Trust Fund.

term.#tail:
means a project for the restoration of a major project or major
			 project feature that has an estimated cost greater than $100,000,000.

. Such program may be based on the 20-year capital

			 approved by the Inland Waterways Users Board.

text.#text:

Amounts in the Inland Waterways Trust
				Fund may not be used to pay for any part of the cost to construct an authorized

the total authorized cost to construct

				rehabilitation evaluation report;

an adjustment for inflation for the
